title: Eps. 109 - Bathroom Burglar
description:
Often times in business you’ll run into individuals who want to do business or may even be doing business, yet they don’t understand business. ET expresses his frustration with these individuals because what they don’t understand is the sacrifices that come with doing business. The guy’s pack this week’s podcast with plenty of insight on what it takes to truly to make a business successful. Karl talks about how there is never a perfect time to do anything, CJ chimes in on you should never put money ahead of the brand, and ET explains how your ignorance doesn’t allow you to see what it takes to truly be successful. Grab a pen and paper for this one, you’re going to need it.
 Time Stamped Topics:
  [02:30] - Karl In Barbados
 [08:45] - Fair or Foul
 [20:25] - ET Vents
 [36:45] - There Is No Perfect Moment
 [54:10] - Ignorance
 [1:16:30] - Ask ET
 [1:20:45] - Nugget of The Day
  Listener Perks:
  Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go.
  Things To Think About:
  “It is the failure that makes you better.”
 “If you present yourself as perfect you have a problem.”
 “Don’t wait for the perfect moment, take the moment and make it perfect.”
  Book Recommendation:
  Shoe Dog By: Phil Knight
  See ET Live:
  February 4, 2018 Take Control Miami

 February 10, 2018 Take Control Atlanta

 February 28, 2019 Take Control Charlotte

 March 4-11th, 2018  Phenomenal Life Cruise

 March 17, 2018 Take Control Dallas, TX

  Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via  Apple Podcasts

Often times in business you’ll run into individuals who want to do business or may even be doing business, yet they don’t understand business. ET expresses his frustration with these individuals because what they don’t understand is the sacrifices that come with doing business. The guy’s pack this week’s podcast with plenty of insight on what it takes to truly to make a business successful. Karl talks about how there is never a perfect time to do anything, CJ chimes in on you should never put money ahead of the brand, and ET explains how your ignorance doesn’t allow you to see what it takes to truly be successful. Grab a pen and paper for this one, you’re going to need it.
